text: ... _across half a Galaxy, the Terran Empire maintains its sovereignty
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: with the consent of the governed. It is a peaceful reign, held by
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: compact and not by conquest. Again and again, when rebellion threatens
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the Terran Peace, the natives of the rebellious world have turned
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: against their own people and sided with the men of Terra; not from fear,
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: but from a sense of dedication._
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: _There has never been open war. The battle for these worlds is fought in
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the minds of a few men who stand between worlds; bound to one world by
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: interest, loyalties and allegiance; bound to the other by love._
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: _Such a world is Wolf. Such a man was Race Cargill of the Terran Secret
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Service._
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: =Author's Note:--=
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I've always wanted to write. But not until I discovered the old pulp
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: science-fantasy magazines, at the age of sixteen, did this general
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: desire become a specific urge to write science-fantasy adventures.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I took a lot of detours on the way. I discovered s-f in its golden age:
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the age of Kuttner, C.L. Moore, Leigh Brackett, Ed Hamilton and Jack
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Vance. But while I was still collecting rejection slips for my early
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: efforts, the fashion changed. Adventures on faraway worlds and strange
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: dimensions went out of fashion, and the new look in
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: science-fiction--emphasis on the _science_--came in.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: So my first stories were straight science-fiction, and I'm not trying to
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: put down that kind of story. It has its place. By and large, the kind of
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: science-fiction which makes tomorrow's headlines as near as this
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: morning's coffee, has enlarged popular awareness of the modern,
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: miraculous world of science we live in. It has helped generations of
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: young people feel at ease with a rapidly changing world.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: But fashions change, old loves return, and now that Sputniks clutter up
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the sky with new and unfamiliar moons, the readers of science-fiction
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: are willing to wait for tomorrow to read tomorrow's headlines. Once
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: again, I think, there is a place, a wish, a need and hunger for the
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: wonder and color of the world way out. The world beyond the stars. The
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: world we _won't_ live to see. That is why I wrote THE DOOR THROUGH
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: SPACE.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: --MARION ZIMMER BRADLEY

text: CHAPTER ONE
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Beyond the spaceport gates, the men of the Kharsa were hunting down a
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: thief. I heard the shrill cries, the pad-padding of feet in strides just
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: a little too long and loping to be human, raising echoes all down the
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: dark and dusty streets leading up to the main square.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: But the square itself lay empty in the crimson noon of Wolf. Overhead
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the dim red ember of Phi Coronis, Wolf's old and dying sun, gave out a
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: pale and heatless light. The pair of Spaceforce guards at the gates,
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: wearing the black leathers of the Terran Empire, shockers holstered at
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: their belts, were drowsing under the arched gateway where the
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: star-and-rocket emblem proclaimed the domain of Terra. One of them, a
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: snub-nosed youngster only a few weeks out from Earth, cocked an
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: inquisitive ear at the cries and scuffling feet, then jerked his head at
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: me.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Hey, Cargill, you can talk their lingo. What's going on out there?"
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I stepped out past the gateway to listen. There was still no one to be
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: seen in the square. It lay white and windswept, a barricade of
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: emptiness; to one side the spaceport and the white skyscraper of the
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Terran Headquarters, and at the other side, the clutter of low
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: buildings, the street-shrine, the little spaceport cafe smelling of
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: coffee and _jaco_, and the dark opening mouths of streets that rambled
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: down into the Kharsa--the old town, the native quarter. But I was alone
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: in the square with the shrill cries--closer now, raising echoes from the
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: enclosing walls--and the loping of many feet down one of the dirty
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: streets.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Then I saw him running, dodging, a hail of stones flying round his head;
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: someone or something small and cloaked and agile. Behind him the
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: still-faceless mob howled and threw stones. I could not yet understand
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the cries; but they were out for blood, and I knew it.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I said briefly, "Trouble coming," just before the mob spilled out into
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the square. The fleeing dwarf stared about wildly for an instant, his
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: head jerking from side to side so rapidly that it was impossible to get
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: even a fleeting impression of his face--human or nonhuman, familiar or
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: bizarre. Then, like a pellet loosed from its sling, he made straight for
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the gateway and safety.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: And behind him the loping mob yelled and howled and came pouring over
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: half the square. Just half. Then by that sudden intuition which
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: permeates even the most crazed mob with some semblance of reason, they
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: came to a ragged halt, heads turning from side to side.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I stepped up on the lower step of the Headquarters building, and looked
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: them over.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Most of them were _chaks_, the furred man-tall nonhumans of the Kharsa,
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and not the better class. Their fur was unkempt, their tails naked with
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: filth and disease. Their leather aprons hung in tatters. One or two in
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the crowd were humans, the dregs of the Kharsa. But the star-and-rocket
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: emblem blazoned across the spaceport gates sobered even the wildest
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: blood-lust somewhat; they milled and shifted uneasily in their half of
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the square.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: For a moment I did not see where their quarry had gone. Then I saw him
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: crouched, not four feet from me, in a patch of shadow. Simultaneously
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the mob saw him, huddled just beyond the gateway, and a howl of
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: frustration and rage went ringing round the square. Someone threw a
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: stone. It zipped over my head, narrowly missing me, and landed at the
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: feet of the black-leathered guard. He jerked his head up and gestured
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: with the shocker which had suddenly come unholstered.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The gesture should have been enough. On Wolf, Terran law has been
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: written in blood and fire and exploding atoms; and the line is drawn
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: firm and clear. The men of Spaceforce do not interfere in the old town,
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: or in any of the native cities. But when violence steps over the
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: threshold, passing the blazon of the star and rocket, punishment is
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: swift and terrible. The threat should have been enough.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Instead a howl of abuse went up from the crowd.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "_Terranan!_"
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Son of the Ape!"
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The Spaceforce guards were shoulder to shoulder behind me now. The
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: snub-nosed kid, looking slightly pale, called out. "Get inside the
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: gates, Cargill! If I have to shoot--"
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The older man motioned him to silence. "Wait. Cargill," he called.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I nodded to show that I heard.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "You talk their lingo. Tell them to haul off! Damned if I want to
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: shoot!"
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I stepped down and walked into the open square, across the crumbled
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: white stones, toward the ragged mob. Even with two armed Spaceforce men
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: at my back, it made my skin crawl, but I flung up my empty hand in token
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: of peace:
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Take your mob out of the square," I shouted in the jargon of the
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Kharsa. "This territory is held in compact of peace! Settle your
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: quarrels elsewhere!"
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: There was a little stirring in the crowd. The shock of being addressed
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: in their own tongue, instead of the Terran Standard which the Empire has
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: forced on Wolf, held them silent for a minute. I had learned that long
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: ago: that speaking in any of the languages of Wolf would give me a
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: minute's advantage.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: But only a minute. Then one of the mob yelled, "We'll go if you give'm
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: to us! He's no right to Terran sanctuary!"
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I walked over to the huddled dwarf, miserably trying to make himself
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: smaller against the wall. I nudged him with my foot.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Get up. Who are you?"
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The hood fell away from his face as he twitched to his feet. He was
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: trembling violently. In the shadow of the hood I saw a furred face, a
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: quivering velvety muzzle, and great soft golden eyes which held
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: intelligence and terror.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "What have you done? Can't you talk?"
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: He held out the tray which he had shielded under his cloak, an ordinary
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: peddler's tray. "Toys. Sell toys. Children. You got'm?"
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I shook my head and pushed the creature away, with only a glance at the
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: array of delicately crafted manikins, tiny animals, prisms and crystal
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: whirligigs. "You'd better get out of here. Scram. Down that street." I
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: pointed.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: A voice from the crowd shouted again, and it had a very ugly sound. "He
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: is a spy of Nebran!"
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "_Nebran--_" The dwarfish nonhuman gabbled something then doubled
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: behind me. I saw him dodge, feint in the direction of the gates, then,
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: as the crowd surged that way, run for the street-shrine across the
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: square, slipping from recess to recess of the wall. A hail of stones
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: went flying in that direction. The little toy-seller dodged into the
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: street-shrine.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Then there was a hoarse "Ah, aaah!" of terror, and the crowd edged away,
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: surged backward. The next minute it had begun to melt away, its entity
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: dissolving into separate creatures, slipping into the side alleys and
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the dark streets that disgorged into the square. Within three minutes
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the square lay empty again in the pale-crimson noon.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The kid in black leather let his breath go and swore, slipping his
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: shocker into its holster. He stared and demanded profanely, "Where'd the
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: little fellow go?"
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Who knows?" the other shrugged. "Probably sneaked into one of the
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: alleys. Did you see where he went, Cargill?"
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I came slowly back to the gateway. To me, it had seemed that he ducked
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: into the street-shrine and vanished into thin air, but I've lived on
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Wolf long enough to know you can't trust your eyes here. I said so, and
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the kid swore again, gulping, more upset than he wanted to admit. "Does
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: this kind of thing happen often?"
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "All the time," his companion assured him soberly, with a sidewise wink
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: at me. I didn't return the wink.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The kid wouldn't let it drop. "Where did you learn their lingo, Mr.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Cargill?"
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "I've been on Wolf a long time," I said, spun on my heel and walked
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: toward Headquarters. I tried not to hear, but their voices followed me
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: anyhow, discreetly lowered, but not lowered enough.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Kid, don't you know who he is? That's Cargill of the Secret Service!
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Six years ago he was the best man in Intelligence, before--" The voice
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: lowered another decibel, and then there was the kid's voice asking,
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: shaken, "But what the hell happened to his face?"
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I should have been used to it by now. I'd been hearing it, more or less
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: behind my back, for six years. Well, if my luck held, I'd never hear it
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: again. I strode up the white steps of the skyscraper, to finish the
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: arrangements that would take me away from Wolf forever. To the other end
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: of the Empire, to the other end of the galaxy--anywhere, so long as I
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: need not wear my past like a medallion around my neck, or blazoned and
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: branded on what was left of my ruined face.

text: CHAPTER TWO
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The Terran Empire has set its blazon on four hundred planets circling
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: more than three hundred suns. But no matter what the color of the sun,
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the number of moons overhead, or the geography of the planet, once you
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: step inside a Headquarters building, you are on Earth. And Earth would
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: be alien to many who called themselves Earthmen, judging by the
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: strangeness I always felt when I stepped into that marble-and-glass
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: world inside the skyscraper. I heard the sound of my steps ringing into
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: thin resonance along the marble corridor, and squinted my eyes,
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: readjusting them painfully to the cold yellowness of the lights.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The Traffic Division was efficiency made insolent, in glass and chrome
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and polished steel, mirrors and windows and looming electronic clerical
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: machines. Most of one wall was taken up by a TV monitor which gave a
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: view of the spaceport; a vast open space lighted with blue-white mercury
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: vapor lamps, and a chained-down skyscraper of a starship, littered over
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: with swarming ants. The process crew was getting the big ship ready for
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: skylift tomorrow morning. I gave it a second and then a third look. I'd
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: be on it when it lifted.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Turning away from the monitored spaceport, I watched myself stride
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: forward in the mirrored surfaces that were everywhere; a tall man, a
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: lean man, bleached out by years under a red sun, and deeply scarred on
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: both cheeks and around the mouth. Even after six years behind a desk, my
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: neat business clothes--suitable for an Earthman with a desk job--didn't
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: fit quite right, and I still rose unconsciously on the balls of my feet,
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: approximating the lean stooping walk of a Dry-towner from the Coronis
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: plains.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The clerk behind the sign marked TRANSPORTATION was a little rabbit of a
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: man with a sunlamp tan, barricaded by a small-sized spaceport of desk,
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and looking as if he liked being shut up there. He looked up in civil
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: inquiry.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Can I do something for you?"
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "My name's Cargill. Have you a pass for me?"
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: He stared. A free pass aboard a starship is rare except for professional
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: spacemen, which I obviously wasn't. "Let me check my records," he
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: hedged, and punched scanning buttons on the glassy surface. Shadows came
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and went, and I saw myself half-reflected, a tipsy shadow in a flurry of
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: racing colors. The pattern finally stabilized and the clerk read off
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: names.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Brill, Cameron ... ah, yes. Cargill, Race Andrew, Department 38,
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: transfer transportation. Is that you?"
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I admitted it and he started punching more buttons when the sound of the
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: name made connection in whatever desk-clerks use for a brain. He stopped
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: with his hand halfway to the button.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Are you Race Cargill of the Secret Service, sir? _The_ Race Cargill?"
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "It's right there," I said, gesturing wearily at the projected pattern
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: under the glassy surface.

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: on Wolf, if you know how. And I knew, or had known once. Loyalty to
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space

text: out there in the Dry-towns, and then taken it away again?
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: in Intelligence. I had had two years more than my share. I still knew
title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: under the catmen, and I knew no way to refuse without exposing myself

author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: for the sham trader I was. But I was deathly apprehensive. Even with
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: On Wolf, human and nonhuman have lived side by side for centuries. And
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the human is not always the superior being. I might pass, among the
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: round, beehive fashion, and the streets totally empty. Just inside the
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: him. He was covered from head to foot with some coarse and shiny fiber
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: like a recognizable human shape or walk, and I felt the primeval ape in
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: me cowering and gibbering in a corner of my brain. Kyral muttered, close
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space

text: their real form. I think they're deaf and dumb, but be damn careful."
title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space

author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: instruments. Again the little swirl in the air, and the instruments
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: than bargaining with anyone anywhere. Nevertheless, under the eyes of
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space

author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space

author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the cry making ringing echoes in the strange street:
title: The Door Through Space

author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space

text: CHAPTER SEVEN
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Shainsa, first in the chain of Dry-towns that lie in the bed of a
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: long-dried ocean, is set at the center of a great alkali plain; a dusty,
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: parched city bleached by a million years of sun. The houses are high,
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: spreading buildings with many rooms and wide windows. The poorer sort
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: were made of sun-dried brick, the more imposing being cut from the
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: bleached salt stone of the cliffs that rise behind the city.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: News travels fast in the Dry-towns. If Rakhal were in the city, he'd
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: soon know that I was here, and guess who I was or why I'd come. I might
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: disguise myself so that my own sister, or the mother who bore me, would
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: not know me. But I had no illusions about my ability to disguise myself
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: from Rakhal. He had created the disguise that was me.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: When the second sun set, red and burning, behind the salt cliffs, I knew
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: he was not in Shainsa, but I stayed on, waiting for something to happen.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: At night I slept in a cubbyhole behind a wineshop, paying an inordinate
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: price for that very dubious privilege. And every day in the sleepy
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: silence of the blood-red noon I paced the public square of Shainsa.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: business. No one appeared to see me except the dusty children, with pale
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: fleecy hair, who played their patient games on the windswept curbing of
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the square. They surveyed my scarred face with neither curiosity or
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: fear, and it occurred to me that Rindy might be such another as these.
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: question one of the children, or win their confidence. But I had a
title: The Door Through Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Door Through Space

title: The Door Through Space

text: SUDDEN PANIC
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: It was a week before the Lhari ship went into warp-drive, and all that
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: time young Bart Steele had stayed in his cabin. He was so bored with his
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: own company that the Mentorian medic was a welcome sight when he came to
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: prepare him for _cold-sleep_.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The Mentorian paused, needle in hand. "Do you wish to be wakened for the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: time we shall spend in each of the three star systems, sir? You can, of
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: course, be given enough drug to keep you in cold-sleep until we reach
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: your destination."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart felt tempted--he wanted very much to see the other star systems.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: But he couldn't risk meeting other passengers.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The needle went into his arm. In sudden panic, he realized he was
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: helpless. The ship would touch down on three worlds, and on any of them
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the Lhari might have his description, or his alias! He could be taken
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: off, unconscious, and might never wake up! He tried to move, to protest,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: but he couldn't. There was a freezing moment of intense cold and then
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: nothing....

text: CHAPTER ONE
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The Lhari spaceport didn't belong on Earth.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart Steele had thought that, a long time ago, when he first saw it. He
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: had been just a kid then; twelve years old, and all excited about seeing
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Earth for the first time--Earth, the legendary home of mankind before
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the Age of Space, the planet of Bart's far-back ancestors. And the first
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: thing he'd seen on Earth, when he got off the starship, was the Lhari
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: spaceport.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: And he'd thought, right then, _It doesn't belong on Earth._
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: He'd said so to his father, and his father's face had gone strange,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: bitter and remote.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "A lot of people would agree with you, Son," Captain Rupert Steele had
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: said softly. "The trouble is, if the Lhari spaceport wasn't on Earth, we
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: wouldn't be on Earth either. Remember that."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart remembered it, five years later, as he got off the strip of moving
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: sidewalk. He turned to wait for Tommy Kendron, who was getting his
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: baggage off the center strip of the moving roadway. Bart Steele and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Tommy Kendron had graduated together, the day before, from the Space
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Academy of Earth. Now Tommy, who had been born on the ninth planet of
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the star Capella, was taking the Lhari starship to his faraway home, and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart's father was coming back to Earth, on the same starship, to meet
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: his son.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: _Five years,_ Bart thought. _That's a long time. I wonder if Dad will
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: know me?_
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Let me give you a hand with that stuff, Tommy."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "I can manage," Tommy chuckled, hefting the plastic cases. "They don't
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: allow you much baggage weight on the Lhari ships. Certainly not more
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: than I can handle."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The two lads stood in front of the spaceport gate for a minute. Over the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: gate, which was high and pointed and made of some clear colorless
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: material like glass, was a jagged symbol resembling a flash of
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: lightning; the sign, in Lhari language, for the home world of the Lhari.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: They walked through the pointed glass gate, and stood for a moment, by
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: mutual consent, looking down over the vast expanse of the Lhari
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: spaceport.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: This had once been a great desert. Now it was all floored in with some
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: strange substance that was neither glass, metal nor concrete; it looked
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: like gleaming crystal--though it felt soft underfoot--and in the glare
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: of the noonday sun, it gave back the glare in a million rainbow flashes.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Tommy put his hands up to his eyes to shield them. "The Lhari must have
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: funny eyes, if they can stand all this glare!"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Inside the glass gate, a man in a guard's uniform gave them each a pair
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: of dark glasses. "Put them on now, boys. And don't look directly at the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: ship when it lands."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Tommy hooked the earpieces of the dark glasses over his ears, and sighed
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: with relief. Bart frowned, but finally put them on. Bart's mother had
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: been a Mentorian--from the planet Mentor, of the star Deneb, a hundred
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: times brighter than the sun. Bart had her eyes. But Mentorians weren't
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: popular on Earth, and Bart had learned to be quiet about his mother.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Through the dark lenses, the glare was only a pale gleam. Far out in the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: very center of the spaceport, a high, clear-glass skyscraper rose,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: catching the sunlight in a million colors. Around the building, small
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: copters and robotcabs veered, discharging passengers; and the moving
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: sidewalks were crowded with people coming and going. Here and there in
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the crowd, standing out because of their height and the silvery metallic
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: cloaks they wore, were the strange tall figures of the Lhari.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Well, how about going down?" Tommy glanced impatiently at his
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: timepiece. "Less than half an hour before the starship touches down."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "All right. We can get a sidewalk over here." Reluctantly, Bart tore his
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: eyes from the fascinating spectacle, and followed Tommy, stepping onto
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: one of the sidewalks. It bore them down a long, sloping ramp toward the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: floor of the spaceport, then sped toward the glass skyscraper; came to
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: rest at the wide pointed doors, depositing them in the midst of the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: crowd. The jagged lightning flash was there over the doors of the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: building, and the words:
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: HERE, BY THE GRACE OF THE LHARI, IS THE DOORWAY TO ALL THE STARS.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart remembered, as if it were yesterday, how he and his father had
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: first passed through this doorway. And his father, looking up, had said
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: under his breath "Not for always, Son. Someday men will have a doorway
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: to the stars, and the Lhari won't be standing in the door."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Inside the building, it was searingly bright. The high open rotunda was
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: filled with immense mirrors, and glass ramps running up and down, moving
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: staircases, confusing signs and flashing lights on tall oddly shaped
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: pillars. The place was crowded with men from all over the planet, but
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the dark glasses they all wore gave them a strange sort of family
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: resemblance.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Tommy said, "I'd better check my reservations."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart nodded. "Meet you on the upper level later," he said, and got on a
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: moving staircase that soared slowly upward, past level after level,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: toward the information desk located on the topmost mezzanine.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The staircase moved slowly, and Bart had plenty of time to see
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: everything. On the step immediately in front of him, two Lhari were
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: standing; with their backs turned, they might almost have been men.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Unusually tall, unusually thin, but men. Then Bart amended that
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: mentally. The Lhari had two arms, two legs and a head apiece--they were
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: that much like men. Their faces had two eyes, two ears, and a nose and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: mouth, all in the right places. But the similarity ended there.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: They had skin of a curious pale silvery gray, and pale, pure-white hair
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: rising in what looked like a feathery crest. The eyes were long and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: slanting, the forehead high and narrow, the nose delicately thin and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: chiseled with long vertically slit nostrils, the ears long, pointed and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: lobeless. The mouth looked almost human, though the chin was abnormally
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: pointed. The hands would almost have passed inspection as human
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: hands--except for the long, triangular nails curved over the fingertips
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: like the claws of a cat. They wore skin-tight clothes of some metallic
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: silky stuff, and long flowing gleaming silvery capes. They looked
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: unearthly, elfin and strange, and in their own way they were beautiful.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The two Lhari in front of Bart had been talking softly, in their fast
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: twittering speech; but as the hum of the crowds on the upper levels grew
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: louder, they raised their voices, and Bart could hear what they were
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: saying. He was a little surprised to find that he could still understand
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the Lhari language. He hadn't heard a word of it in years--not since his
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Mentorian mother died. The Lhari would never guess that he could
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: understand their speech. Not one human in a million could speak or
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: understand a dozen words of Lhari, except the Mentorians.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Do you really think that _human_--" the first Lhari spoke the word as
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: if it were a filthy insult--"will have the temerity to come in by this
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: ship?"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "No reasonable being can tell what _humans_ will do," said the second
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Lhari. "But then, no reasonable being can tell what our own Port
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Authorities will do either! If the message had only reached us sooner,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: it would have been easier. Now I suppose it will have to clear through a
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: dozen officials and a dozen different kinds of formalities."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The younger Lhari sounded angry. "And we have only a description--no
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: name, nothing! How do they expect us to do anything under those
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: conditions? What I can't understand is how it ever happened, or how the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: man managed to get away. What worries me is the possibility that he may
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: have communicated with others we don't know about. Those bungling fools
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: who let the first man get away can't even be sure--"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Do not speak of it here," said the old Lhari sharply. "There are
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Mentorians in the crowd who might understand us." He turned and looked
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: straight at Bart, and Bart felt as if the slanted strange eyes were
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: looking right through to his bones. The Lhari said, in Universal, "Who
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: are you, boy? What iss your businesssses here?"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart replied in the same language, politely, "My father's coming in on
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: this ship. I'm looking for the information desk."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Up there," said the old Lhari, pointing with a clawed hand, and lost
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: interest in Bart. He said to his companion, in their own language,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Always, I regret these episodes. I have no malice against humans. I
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: suppose even this Vegan that we are seeking has young, and a mate, who
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: will regret his loss."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Then he should not have pried into Lhari matters," said the younger
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Lhari fiercely. "If they'd killed him right away--"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The soaring staircase swooped up to the top level; the two Lhari stepped
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: off and mingled swiftly with the crowd, being lost to sight. Bart
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: whistled in dismay as he got off and turned toward the information desk.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: A Vegan! Some poor guy from his own planet was in trouble with the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Lhari. He felt a cold, crawling chill down his insides. The Lhari had
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: spoken regretfully, but the way they'd speak of a fly they couldn't
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: manage to swat fast enough. Sooner or later you had to get down to it,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: they just weren't human!
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Here on Earth, nothing much could happen, of course. They wouldn't let
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the Lhari hurt anyone--then Bart remembered his course in Universal Law.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The Lhari spaceport in every system, by treaty, was Lhari territory.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Once you walked beneath the lightning-flash sign, the authority of the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: planet ceased to function; you might as well be on that unbelievably
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: world no human had ever seen. On a Lhari spaceport, or on a Lhari ship,
title: The Colors of Space

text: you were under the jurisdiction of Lhari law.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Tommy stepped off a moving stair and joined him. "The ship's on time--it
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: _cold sweet_, and finally decided to try it. The name proved
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: descriptive; it was very cold, very sweet and indescribably delicious.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Lhari are alike in a lot of ways. They breathe the same air. Eat about
title: The Colors of Space
