text: the same food." Their bodies were adjusted to about the same gravity.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: They had the same body chemistry--in fact, you couldn't tell Lhari blood
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: from human, even under a microscope. And in the terrible Orion Spaceport
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: wreck sixty years ago, doctors had found that blood plasma from humans
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: could be used for wounded Lhari, and vice versa, though it wasn't safe
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: to transfuse whole blood. But then, even among humans there were five
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: blood types.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: And yet, for all their likeness, they were _different_.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart sipped the cold Lhari drink, seeing himself in the mirror behind
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the refreshment stand; a tall teen-ager, looking older than his
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: seventeen years. He was lithe and well muscled from five years of sports
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and acrobatics at the Space Academy, he had curling red hair and gray
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: eyes, and he was almost as tall as a Lhari.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: _Will Dad know me? I was just a little kid when he left me here, and now
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I'm grown-up._
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Tommy grinned at him in the mirror. "What are you going to do, now we've
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: finished our so-called education?"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "What do you think? Go back to Vega with Dad, by Lhari ship, and help
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: him run Vega Interplanet. Why else would I bother with all that
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: astrogation and math?"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "You're the lucky one, with your father owning a dozen ships! He must be
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: almost as rich as the Lhari."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart shook his head. "It's not that easy. Space travel inside a system
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: these days is small stuff; all the real travel and shipping goes to the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Lhari ships."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: It was a sore point with everyone. Thousands of years ago, men had
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: spread out from Earth--first to the planets, then to the nearer stars,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: crawling in ships that could travel no faster than the speed of light.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: They had even believed that was an absolute limit--that nothing in the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: universe could exceed the speed of light. It took years to go from Earth
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: to the nearest star.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: But they'd done it. From the nearer stars, they had sent out colonizing
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: ships all through the galaxy. Some vanished and were never heard from
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: again, but some made it, and in a few centuries man had spread all over
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: hundreds of star-systems.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: And then man met the people of the Lhari.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: It was a big universe, with measureless millions of stars, and plenty of
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: room for more than two intelligent civilizations. It wasn't surprising
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: that the Lhari, who had only been traveling space for a couple of
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: thousand years themselves, had never come across humans before. But they
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: had been delighted to meet another intelligent race--and it was
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: extremely profitable.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Because men were still held, mostly, to the planets of their own
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: star-systems. Ships traveling between the stars by light-drive were rare
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and ruinously expensive. But the Lhari had the warp-drive, and almost
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: overnight the whole picture changed. By warp-drive, hundreds of times
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: faster than light at peak, the years-long trip between Vega and Earth,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: for instance, was reduced to about three months, at a price anyone could
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: pay. Mankind could trade and travel all over their galaxy, but they did
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: it on Lhari ships. The Lhari had an absolute, unbreakable monopoly on
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: star travel.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "That's what hurts," Tommy said. "It wouldn't do us any good to have the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: star-drive. Humans can't stand faster-than-light travel, except in
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: cold-sleep."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart nodded. The Lhari ships traveled at normal speeds, like the regular
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: planetary ships, inside each star-system. Then, at the borders of the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: vast gulf of emptiness between stars, they went into warp-drive; but
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: first, every human on board was given the cold-sleep treatment that
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: placed them in suspended animation, allowing their bodies to endure the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: warp-drive.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: He finished his drink. The increasing bustle in the crowds below them
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: told him that time must be getting short. A tall, impressive-looking
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Lhari strode through the crowd, followed at a respectful distance by two
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Mentorians, tall, redheaded humans wearing metallic cloaks like those of
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the Lhari. Tommy nudged Bart, his face bitter.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Look at those lousy Mentorians! How can they do it? Fawning upon the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Lhari that way, yet they're as human as we are! _Slaves_ of the Lhari!"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart felt the involuntary surge of anger, instantly controlled. "It's
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: not that way at all. My mother was a Mentorian, remember. She made five
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: cruises on a Lhari ship before she married my father."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Tommy sighed. "I guess I'm just jealous--to think the Mentorians can
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: sign on the Lhari ship as crew, while you and I will never pilot a ship
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: between the stars. What did she do?"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "She was a mathematician. Before the Lhari met up with men, they used a
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: system of mathematics as clumsy as the old Roman numerals. You have to
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: admire them, when you realize that they learned stellar navigation with
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: their old system, though most ships use human math now. And of course,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: you know their eyes aren't like ours. Among other things, they're
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: color-blind. They see everything in shades of black or white or gray.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "So they found out that humans aboard their ships were useful. You
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: remember how humans, in the early days in space, used certain birds, who
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: were more sensitive to impure air than they were. When the birds keeled
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: over, they could tell it was time for humans to start looking over the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: air systems! The Lhari use Mentorians to identify colors for them. And,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: since Mentor was the first planet of humans that the Lhari had contact
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: with, they've always been closer to them."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Tommy looked after the two Mentorians enviously. "The fact is, I'd ship
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: out with the Lhari myself if I could. Wouldn't you?"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart's mouth twisted in a wry smile. "No," he said. "I could--I'm half
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Mentorian, I can even speak Lhari."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Why don't you? I would."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Oh, no, you wouldn't," Bart said softly. "Not even very many Mentorians
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: will. You see, the Lhari don't trust humans too much. In the early days,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: men were always planting spies on Lhari ships, to try and steal the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: secret of warp-drive. They never managed it, but nowadays the Lhari give
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: all the Mentorians what amounts to a brainwashing--deep hypnosis, before
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and after every voyage, so that they can neither look for anything that
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: might threaten the Lhari monopoly of space, nor reveal it--even under a
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: truth drug--if they find it out.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "You have to be pretty fanatical about space travel to go through that.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Oh, my mother could tell us a lot of things about her cruises with the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Lhari. The Lhari can't tell a diamond from a ruby, except by
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: spectrographic analysis, for instance. And she--"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: A high gong note sounded somewhere, touching off an explosion of warning
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: bells and buzzers all over the enormous building. Bart looked up.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "The ship must be coming in to land."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "I'd better check into the passenger side," Tommy said. He stuck out his
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: hand. "Well, Bart, I guess this is where we say good-bye."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: They shook hands, their eyes meeting for a moment in honest grief. In
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: some indefinable way, this parting marked the end of their boyhood.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Good luck, Tom. I'm going to miss you."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: They wrung each other's hands again, hard. Then Tommy picked up his
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: luggage and started down a sloping ramp toward an enclosure marked TO
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: PASSENGER ENTRANCE.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Warning bells rang again. The glare intensified until the glow in the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: sky was unendurable, but Bart looked anyhow, making out the strange
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: shape of the Lhari ship from the stars.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: It was huge and strange, glowing with colors Bart had never seen before.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: It settled down slowly, softly: enormous, silent, vibrating, glowing;
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: then swiftly faded to white-hot, gleaming blue, dulling down through the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: visible spectrum to red. At last it was just gleaming glassy Lhari-metal
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: color again. High up in the ship's side a yawning gap slid open,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: extruding stairsteps, and men and Lhari began to descend.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart ran down a ramp and surged out on the field with the crowd. His
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: eyes, alert for his father's tall figure, noted with surprise that the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: ship's stairs were guarded by four cloaked Lhari, each with a Mentorian
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: interpreter. They were stopping each person who got off the starship,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: asking for identity papers. Bart realized he was seeing another segment
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: of the same drama he had overheard discussed, and wished he knew what it
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: was all about.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The crowd was thinning now. Robotcabs were swerving in, hovering above
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the ground to pick up passengers, then veering away. The gap in the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: starship's side was closing, and still Bart had not seen the tall, slim,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: flame-haired figure of his father. The port on the other side of the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: ship, he knew, was for loading passengers. Bart moved carefully through
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the thinning crowd, almost to the foot of the stairs. One of the Lhari
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: checking papers stopped and fixed him with an inscrutable gray stare,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: but finally turned away again.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart began really to worry. Captain Steele would never miss his ship!
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: But he saw only one disembarking passenger who had not yet been
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: surrounded by a group of welcoming relatives, or summoned a robotcab and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: gone. The man was wearing Vegan clothes, but he wasn't Bart's father. He
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: was a fat little man, with ruddy cheeks and a fringe of curling gray
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: hair all around his bald dome. _Maybe he'd know if there was another
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Vegan on the ship._
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Then Bart realized that the little fat man was staring straight at him.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: He returned the man's smile, rather hesitantly; then blinked, for the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: fat man was coming straight toward him.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Hello, Son," the fat man said loudly. Then, as two of the Lhari started
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: toward him, the strange man did an incredible thing. He reached out his
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: two hands and grabbed Bart.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Well, boy, you've sure grown," he said, in a loud, cheerful voice, "but
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: you're not too grown-up to give your old Dad a good hug, are you?" He
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: pulled Bart roughly into his arms. Bart started to pull away and stammer
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: that the fat man had made a mistake, but the pudgy hand gripped his
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: wrist with unexpected strength.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Bart, listen to me," the stranger whispered, in a harsh fast voice. "Go
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: along with this or we're both dead. See those two Lhari watching us?
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Call me Dad, good and loud, if you want to live. Because, believe me,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: your life's in danger--right now!"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: CHAPTER TWO
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: For a moment, pulled off balance in the fat stranger's hug, Bart
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: remained perfectly still, while the man repeated in that loud, jovial
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: voice, "How you've grown!" He let him go, stepping away a pace or two,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and whispered urgently, "Say something. And take that stupid look off
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: your face."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: As he stepped back, Bart saw his eyes. In the chubby, good-natured red
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: face, the stranger's eyes were half-mad with fear.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: In a split second, Bart remembered the two Lhari and their talk of a
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: fugitive. In that moment, Bart Steele grew up.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: He stepped toward the man and took him quickly by the shoulders.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Dad, you sure surprised me," he said, trying to keep his voice from
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: shaking. "Been such a long time, I'd--half forgotten what you looked
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: like. Have a good trip?"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "About like always." The fat man was breathing hard, but his voice
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: sounded firm and cheerful. "Can't compare with a trip on the old
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: _Asterion_ though." The _Asterion_ was the flagship of Vega Interplanet,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Rupert Steele's own ship. "How's everything?"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Beads of sweat were standing out on the man's ruddy forehead, and his
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: grip on Bart's wrist was so hard it hurt. Bart, grasping at random for
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: something to say, gabbled, "Too bad you couldn't get to my graduation. I
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: made th-third in a class of four hundred--"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The Lhari had surrounded them and were closing in.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The fat man took a deep breath or two, said, "Just a minute, Son," and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: turned around. "You want something?"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The tallest of the Lhari--the old one, whom Bart had seen on the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: escalator--looked long and hard at him. When they spoke Universal, their
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: voices were sibilant, but not nearly so inhuman.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Could we trrrouble you to sssshow us your paperrrssss?"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Certainly." Nonchalantly, the fat man dug them out and handed them
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: over. Bart saw his father's name printed across the top.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The Lhari gestured to a Mentorian interpreter: "What colorrr isss thisss
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: man's hairrr?"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The Mentorian said in the Lhari language, "His hair is _gray_." He used
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the Universal word; there were, of course, no words for colors in the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Lhari speech.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "The man we sssseek has hair of _red_," said the Lhari. "And he isss
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: tall, not fat."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "The boy is tall and with _red_ hair," the Mentorian volunteered, and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the old Lhari made a gesture of disdain.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "This boy is twenty years younger than the man whose description came to
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: us. Why did they not give us a picture or at least a name?" He turned to
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the other Lhari and said in their own shrill speech, "I suspected this
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: man because he was alone. And I had seen this boy on the upper mezzanine
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and spoken with him. We watched him, knowing sooner or later the father
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: would seek him. Ask him." He gestured and the Mentorian said, "Who is
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: this man, you?"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart gulped. For the first time he noted the energon-ray shockers at the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: belts of the four Lhari. He'd heard about those. They could stun--or
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: they could kill, and quite horribly. He said, "This is my father. You
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: want my cards, too?" He hauled out his identity papers. "My name's Bart
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Steele."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The Lhari, with a gesture of disgust, handed them back. "Go, then,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: father and son," he said, not unkindly.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Let's get going, Son," said the little bald man. His hand shook on
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart's, and Bart thought, _If we're lucky, we can get out of the port
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: before he faints dead away._ He said "I'll get a copter," and then,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: feeling sorry for the stranger, gave him his arm to lean on. He didn't
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: know whether he was worried or scared. _Where was his father?_ Why did
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: this man have his dad's papers? Was his father hiding inside the Lhari
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: ship? He wanted to run, to burst away from the imposter, but the guy was
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: shaking so hard Bart couldn't just leave him standing there. If the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Lhari got him, he was a dead duck.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: A copter swooped down, the pilot signaling. The little man said
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: hoarsely, "No. Robotcab."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart waved the copter away, getting a dirty look from the pilot, and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: punched a button at the stand for one of the unmanned robotcabs. It
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: swung down, hovered motionless. Bart boosted the fat man in. Inside, the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: man collapsed on the seat, leaning back, puffing, his hand pressed hard
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: to his chest.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Punch a combo for Denver," he said hoarsely.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart obeyed, automatically. Then he turned on the man.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "It's your game, mister! Now tell me what's going on? _Where's my
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: father?_"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The man's eyes were half-shut. He said, gasping, "Don't ask me any
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: questions for a minute." He thumbed a tablet into his mouth, and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: presently his breathing quieted.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "We're safe--for the minute. Those Lhari would have cut us down."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "You, maybe. I haven't done anything. Look, you," Bart said in sudden
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: rage, "you owe me some explanations. For all I know, you're a criminal
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and the Lhari have every right to chase you! Why have you got my
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: father's papers? Did you steal them to get away from the Lhari? _Where's
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: my father?_"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "It's your father they were looking for, you young fool," said the man,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: gasping hard. "Lucky they had only a description and not a name--but
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: they've probably got that by now, uncoded. We've only confused them for
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: a little while. But if you hadn't played along, they'd have had you
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: watched, and when they get hold of the name Steele--they will, sooner or
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: later, the people in the Procyon system--"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: _"Where is my father?"_
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "I hope I don't know," the fat man said. "If he's still where I left
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: him, he's dead. My name is Briscoe. Edmund Briscoe. Your father saved my
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: life years ago, never mind how. The less you know, the safer you'll be
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: for a while. His major worry just now is about you. He was afraid, if he
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: didn't turn up here, you'd take the first ship back to Vega. So he gave
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: me his papers and sent me to warn you--"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart shook his head. "It all sounds phony as can be. How do I know
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: whether to believe you or not?" His hand hovered over the robotcab
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: controls. "We're going straight to the police. If you're okay, they
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: won't turn you over to the Lhari. If you're not--"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "You young fool," said the fat man, with feeble violence, "there's no
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: _time_ for all that! Ask me questions--I can prove I know your father!"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "What was my mother's name?"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Oh, God," Briscoe said, "I never saw her. I knew your father long
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: before you were born. Until he told me, I never knew he'd married or
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: had a son. I'd never have known you, except that you're the living
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: image--" He shook his head helplessly, and his breathing sounded hoarse.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Bart, I'm a sick man, I'm going to die. I want to do what I came here
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: to do, because your father saved my life once when I was young and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: healthy, and gave me twenty good years before I got old and fat and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: sick. Win or lose, I won't live to see you hunted down like a dog, like
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: my own son--"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Don't talk like that," Bart said, a creepy feeling coming over him. "If
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: you're sick, let me take you to a doctor."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Briscoe did not even hear. "Wait, there is something else. Your father
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: said, 'Tell Bart I've gone looking for the Eighth Color. Bart will know
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: what I mean.'"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "That's crazy. I don't know--"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: He broke off, for the memory had come, full-blown:
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: _He was very young: five, six, seven. His mother, tall and slender and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: very fair, was bending over a blueprint, pointing with a delicate finger
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: at something, straightening, saying in her light musical voice:_
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: _"The fuel catalyst--it's a strange color, a color you never saw
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: anywhere. Can you_ think _of a color that isn't red, orange, yellow,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: green, blue, violet, indigo or some combination of them? It isn't any of
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the colors of the spectrum at all. The fuel is a real eighth color."_
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: _And his father had used the phrase, almost adopted it. "When we know
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: what the eighth color is, we'll have the secret of the star-drive,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: too!"_
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Briscoe saw his face change, nodded weakly. "I see it means something to
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: you. Now will you do as I tell you? Within a couple of hours, they'll be
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: combing the planet for you, but by that time the ship I came in on will
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: have taken off again. They only stop a short time here, for mail,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: passengers--no cargo. They may get under way again before all messages
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: are cleared and decoded." He stopped and breathed hard. "The Earth
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: authorities might protect you, but you would never be able to board a
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Lhari ship again--and that would mean staying on Earth for the rest of
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: your life. You've got to get away before they start comparing notes.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Here." His hand went into his pockets. "For your hair. It's a dye--a
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: spray."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: He pressed a button on the bulb in his hand; Bart gasped, feeling cold
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: wetness on his head. His own hand came away stained black.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Keep still." Briscoe said irritably. "You'll need it at the Procyon end
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: of the run. Here." He stuck some papers into Bart's hand, then punched
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: some buttons on the robotcab's control. It wheeled and swerved so
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: rapidly that Bart fell against the fat man's shoulder.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Are you crazy? What are you going to do?"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Briscoe looked straight into Bart's eyes. In his hoarse, sick voice, he
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: said, "Bart, don't worry about me. It's all over for me, whatever
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: happens. Just remember this. What your father is doing is _worth_ doing,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and if you start stalling, arguing, demanding explanations, you can foul
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: up a hundred people--and kill about half of them."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: He closed Bart's fingers roughly over the papers. The robotcab hovered
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: over the spaceport. "Now listen to me, very carefully. When I stop the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: cab, down below, jump out. Don't stop to say good-bye, or ask questions,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: or anything else. Just get out, walk straight through the passenger door
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and straight up the ramp of the ship. Show them that ticket, and get on.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Whatever happens, don't let anything stop you. Bart!" Briscoe shook his
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: shoulder. "Promise! Whatever happens, you'll _get on that ship_!"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart swallowed, feeling as if he'd been shoved into a silly
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: cops-and-robbers game. But Briscoe's urgency had convinced him. "Where
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: am I going?"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "All I have is a name--Raynor Three," Briscoe said, "and the message
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: about the Eighth Color. That's all I know." His mouth twisted again in
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: that painful gasp.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The cab swooped down. Bart found his voice. "But what then? Is Dad
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: there? Will I know--"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "I don't know any more than I've told you," Briscoe said. Abruptly the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: robotcab came to a halt, swaying a little. Briscoe jerked the door open,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: gave Bart a push, and Bart found himself stumbling out on the ramp
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: beside the spaceport building. He caught his balance, looked around, and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: realized that the robotcab was already climbing the sky again.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Immediately before him, neon letters spelled TO PASSENGER ENTRANCE
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: ONLY. Bart stumbled forward. The Lhari by the gate thrust out a
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: disinterested claw. Bart held up what Briscoe had shoved into his hand,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: only now seeing that it was a thin wallet, a set of identity papers and a
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: strip of pink tickets.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Procyon Alpha. Corridor B, straight through." The Lhari gestured, and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart went through the narrow passageway, came out at the other end, and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: found himself at the very base of a curving stair that led up and up
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: toward a door in the side of the huge Lhari ship. Bart hesitated. In
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: another minute he'd be on his way to a strange sun and a strange world,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: on what might well be the wild-goose chase of all time.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Passengers were crowding the steps behind him. Someone shouted suddenly,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Look at that!" and someone else yelled, "Is that guy crazy?"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart looked up. A robotcab was swooping over the spaceport in wild,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: crazy circles, dipping down, suddenly making a dart like an enraged wasp
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: at a little nest of Lhari. They ducked and scattered; the robotcab
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: swerved away, hovered, swooped back. This time it struck one of the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Lhari grazingly with landing gear and knocked him sprawling. Bart stood
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: with his mouth open, as if paralyzed.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: _Briscoe! What was he doing?_
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The fallen Lhari lay without moving. The robotcab moved in again, as if
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: for the kill, buzzing viciously overhead.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Then a beam of light arced from one of the drawn energon-ray tubes. The
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: robotcab glowed briefly red, then seemed to sag, sink together; then
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: puddled, a slag heap of molten metal, on the glassy floor of the port. A
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: little moan of horror came from the crowd, and Bart felt a sudden,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: wrenching sickness. It had been like a game, a silly game of cops and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: robbers, and suddenly it was as serious as melted death lying there on
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the spaceport. _Briscoe!_
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Someone shoved him and said, "Come on, quit gawking, kid. They won't
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: hold the ship all day just because some nut finds a new way to commit
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: suicide."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart, his legs numb, walked up the ramp. Briscoe had died to give him
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: this chance. Now it was up to him to make it worth having.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: CHAPTER THREE
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: At the top of the ramp, a Lhari glanced briefly at his papers, motioned
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: him through. Bart passed through the airlock, and into a brightly lit
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: corridor half full of passengers. The line was moving slowly, and for
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the first time Bart had a chance to think.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: He had never seen violent death before. In this civilized world, you
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: didn't. He knew if he thought about Briscoe, he'd start bawling like a
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: baby, so he swallowed hard a couple of times, set his chin, and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: concentrated on the trip to Procyon Alpha. That meant this ship was
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: outbound on the Aldebaran run--Proxima Centauri, Sirius, Pollux,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Procyon, Capella and Aldebaran.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The line of passengers was disappearing through a doorway. A woman ahead
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: of Bart turned and said nervously, "We won't be put into cold-sleep
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: right away, will we?"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: He reassured her, remembering his inbound trip five years ago. "No, no.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The ship won't go into warp-drive until we're well past Pluto. It will
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: be several days, at least."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Beyond the doorway the lights dwindled, and a Mentorian interpreter took
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: his dark glasses, saying, "Kindly remove your belt, shoes and other
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: accessories of leather or metal before stepping into the decontamination
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: chamber. They will be separately decontaminated and returned to you.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Papers, please."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: With a small twinge of fright, Bart surrendered them. Would the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Mentorian ask why he was carrying two wallets? Inside the other one, he
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: still had his Academy ID card which identified him as Bart Steele, and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: if the Mentorian looked through them to check, and found out he was
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: carrying two sets of identity papers....
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: But the Mentorian merely dumped all his pocket paraphernalia, without
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: looking at it, into a sack. "Just step through here."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Holding up his trousers with both hands, Bart stepped inside the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: indicated cubicle. It was filled with faint bluish light. Bart felt a
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: strong tingling and a faint electrical smell, and along his forearms
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: there was a slight prickling where the small hairs were all standing on
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: end. He knew that the invisible R-rays were killing all the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: microorganisms in his body, so that no disease germ or stray fungus
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: would be carried from planet to planet.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The bluish light died. Outside, the Mentorian gave him back his shoes
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and belt, handed him the paper sack of his belongings, and a paper cup
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: full of greenish fluid.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Drink this."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "What is it?"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The medic said patiently, "Remember, the R-rays killed _all_ the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: microorganisms in your body, including the good ones--the antibodies
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: that protect you against disease, and the small yeasts and bacteria that
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: live in your intestines and help in the digestion of your food. So we
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: have to replace those you need to stay healthy. See?"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The green stuff tasted a little brackish, but Bart got it down all
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: right. He didn't much like the idea of drinking a solution of "germs,"
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: but he knew that was silly. There was a big difference between disease
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: germs and helpful bacteria.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Another Mentorian official, this one a young woman, gave him a key with
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: a numbered tag, and a small booklet with WELCOME ABOARD printed
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: on the cover.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The tag was numbered 246-B, which made Bart raise his eyebrows. B class
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: was normally too expensive for Bart's father's modest purse. It wasn't
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: quite the luxury class A, reserved for planetary governors and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: ambassadors, but it was plenty luxurious. Briscoe had certainly sent him
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: traveling in style!
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: B Deck was a long corridor with oval doors; Bart found one numbered 246,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and, not surprisingly, the key opened it. It was a pleasant little
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: cabin, measuring at least six feet by eight, and he would evidently have
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: it to himself. There was a comfortably big bunk, a light that could be
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: turned on and off instead of the permanent glow-walls of the cheaper
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: class, a private shower and toilet, and a placard on the walls informing
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: him that passengers in B class had the freedom of the Observation Dome
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and the Recreation Lounge. There was even a row of buttons dispensing
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: synthetic foods, in case a passenger preferred privacy or didn't want to
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: wait for meals in the dining hall.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: A buzzer sounded and a Mentorian voice announced, "Five minutes to Room
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Check. Passengers will please remove all metal in their clothing, and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: deposit in the lead drawers. Passengers will please recline in their
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: bunks and fasten the retaining straps before the steward arrives.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Repeat, passengers will please...."
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Bart took off his belt, stuck it and his cuff links in the drawer and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: lay down. Then, in a sudden panic, he got up again. His papers as Bart
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Steele were still in the sack. He got them out, and with a feeling as if
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: he were crossing a bridge and burning it after him, tore up every scrap
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: of paper that identified him as Bart Steele of Vega Four, graduate of
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the Space Academy of Earth. Now, for better or worse, he was--who _was_

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Well, he must try. "Margil sent me to check," he improvised quickly.

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: How are you feeling, Bart?"

author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: before, have a strange history. It scares us. Can you guarantee that
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I suppose he felt that half a dozen deaths were better than half a
title: The Colors of Space

text: he did."

title: The Colors of Space

author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

text: with him, too. And suddenly he knew he would never be lonely again.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: His arm around Meta, his friends--man and Lhari--at his shoulder, he
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: went back to the celebration, to plan for the first intergalactic voyage
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: to the stars.

text: Marion Zimmer Bradley was born in Albany, New York and before she
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: started her writing career she was a file clerk, music teacher and a
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: carnival performer. Her hobbies are reading science fiction novels,
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: going to the opera and listening to folk music.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: In addition to having written a number of other books, she has written
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: more than 30 magazine stories and articles and has been writing
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: professionally for the past ten years.

text: Author of ENCOUNTER and THE GREEN PLANET
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Linc Hosler was sitting in a packed football stadium when the Flying
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Eyes appeared and cast their hypnotic power over half the crowd.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Thousands of people suddenly began marching zombie-like into the woods
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: where they vanished into a black pit.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Linc used every resource of the Space Research Lab and the National
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Guard to destroy the Eyes. But nothing could stop them, for they proved
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: immune to bullets and bombs.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: In desperation, Linc captured an Eye and found a way to communicate with
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: it through his mind. He learned that radiation was fuel for the
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: creatures' lives. And then they issued their terrible ultimatum: Explode
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: a series of atom bombs to supply them with radiation or they would turn
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the world's population into mindless robots.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: It gave the world two harrowing choices--self-destruction via fallout
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: from the bombs or annihilation via the sinister Flying Eyes....

title: The Colors of Space

text: the credit must go to his brother Bobby, for, as campaign manager in the
title: The Colors of Space

text: last election, the younger Kennedy had a great deal to do with getting
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: his brother nominated and then elected.
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Coming into prominence via his work as Chief Counsel to the McClellan
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Committee, he has proven to be a tough fighter and the possessor of an
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: overwhelming will to win. Now, in his dual role as Attorney General and
title: The Colors of Space
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: adviser to the President, he is a power to be reckoned with.

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

title: The Colors of Space

text: _In this warm and fanciful story of a Connecticut farmer, Marion
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Zimmer Bradley has caught some of the glory that is man's love for
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: man--no matter who he is nor whence he's from. By heck, you'll like
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: little Matt._
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: year
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: of
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the

text: big
