text: _by ... Marion Zimmer Bradley_
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Mr. Emmett did his duty by the visitor from
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: another world--never doubting the right of it.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: _You say that Matthew is your own son, Mr. Emmett?_
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Yes, Rev'rend Doane, and a better boy never stepped, if I do say it as
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: shouldn't. I've trusted him to drive team for me since he was eleven,
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and you can't say more than that for a farm boy. Way back when he was a
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: little shaver so high, when the war came on, he was bounden he was going
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: to sail with this Admiral Farragut. You know boys that age--like runaway
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: colts. I couldn't see no good in his being cabin boy on some tarnation
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Navy ship and I told him so. If he'd wanted to sail out on a whaling
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: ship, I 'low I'd have let him go. But Marthy--that's the boy's Ma--took
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: on so that Matt stayed home. Yes, he's a good boy and a good son.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: We'll miss him a powerful lot if he gets this scholarship thing. But I
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: 'low it'll be good for the boy to get some learnin' besides what he gets
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: in the school here. It's right kind of you, Rev'rend, to look over this
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: application thing for me.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: _Well, if he is your own son, Mr. Emmett, why did you write 'birthplace
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: unknown' on the line here?_
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Rev'rend Doane, I'm glad you asked me that question. I've been turnin'
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: it over in my mind and I've jest about come to the conclusion it
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: wouldn't be nohow fair to hold it back. I didn't lie when I said Matt
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: was my son, because he's been a good son to me and Marthy. But I'm not
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: his Pa and Marthy ain't his Ma, so could be I stretched the truth jest a
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: mite. Rev'rend Doane, it's a tarnal funny yarn but I'll walk into the
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: meetin' house and swear to it on a stack o'Bibles as thick as a cord of
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: wood.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: You know I've been farming the old Corning place these past seven year?
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: It's good flat Connecticut bottom-land, but it isn't like our land up in
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Hampshire where I was born and raised. My Pa called it the Hampshire
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Grants and all that was King's land when _his_ Pa came in there and
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: started farming at the foot of Scuttock Mountain. That's Injun for
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: fires, folks say, because the Injuns used to build fires up there in the
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: spring for some of their heathen doodads. Anyhow, up there in the
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: mountains we see a tarnal power of quare things.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: You call to mind the year we had the big thaw, about twelve years before
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the war? You mind the blizzard that year? I heard tell it spread down
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: most to York. And at Fort Orange, the place they call Albany now, the
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Hudson froze right over, so they say. But those York folks do a sight of
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: exaggerating, I'm told.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Anyhow, when the ice went out there was an almighty good thaw all over,
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and when the snow run off Scuttock mountain there was a good-sized hunk
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: of farmland in our valley went under water. The crick on my farm flowed
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: over the bank and there was a foot of water in the cowshed, and down in
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the swimmin' hole in the back pasture wasn't nothing but a big gully
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: fifty foot and more across, rushing through the pasture, deep as a lake
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and brown as the old cow. You know freshet-floods? Full up with sticks
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and stones and old dead trees and somebody's old shed floatin' down the
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: middle. And I swear to goodness, Parson, that stream was running along
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: so fast I saw four-inch cobblestones floating and bumping along.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I tied the cow and the calf and Kate--she was our white mare; you mind
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: she went lame last year and I had to shoot her, but she was just a young
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: mare then and skittish as all get-out--but she was a good little mare.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Anyhow, I tied the whole kit and caboodle of them in the woodshed up
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: behind the house, where they'd be dry, then I started to get the
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: milkpail. Right then I heard the gosh-awfullest screech I ever heard in
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: my life. Sounded like thunder and a freshet and a forest-fire all at
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: once. I dropped the milkpail as I heard Marthy scream inside the house,
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and I run outside. Marthy was already there in the yard and she points
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: up in the sky and yelled, "Look up yander!"
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: We stood looking up at the sky over Shattuck mountain where there was a
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: great big--shoot now, I d'no as I can call its name but it was like a
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: trail of fire in the sky, and it was makin' the dangdest racket you ever
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: heard, Rev'rend. Looked kind of like one of them Fourth-of-July
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: skyrockets, but it was big as a house. Marthy was screaming and she
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: grabbed me and hollered, "Hez! Hez, what in tunket is it?" And when
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Marthy cusses like that, Rev'rend, she don't know what she's saying,
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: she's so scared.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I was plumb scared myself. I heard Liza--that's our young-un, Liza
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Grace, that got married to the Taylor boy. I heard her crying on the
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: stoop, and she came flying out with her pinny all black and hollered to
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Marthy that the pea soup was burning. Marthy let out another screech and
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: ran for the house. That's a woman for you. So I quietened Liza down some
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and I went in and told Marthy it weren't no more than one of them
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: shooting stars. Then I went and did the milking.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: But you know, while we were sitting down to supper there came the most
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: awful grinding, screeching, pounding crash I ever heard. Sounded if it
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: were in the back pasture but the house shook as if somethin' had hit it.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Marthy jumped a mile and I never saw such a look on her face.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Hez, what was that?" she asked.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Shoot, now, nothing but the freshet," I told her.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: But she kept on about it. "You reckon that shooting star fell in our
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: back pasture, Hez?"
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Well, now, I don't 'low it did nothing like that," I told her. But she
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: was jittery as an old hen and it weren't like her nohow. She said it
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: sounded like trouble and I finally quietened her down by saying I'd
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: saddle Kate up and go have a look. I kind of thought, though I didn't
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: tell Marthy, that somebody's house had floated away in the freshet and
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: run aground in our back pasture.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: So I saddled up Kate and told Marthy to get some hot rum ready in case
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: there was some poor soul run aground back there. And I rode Kate back to
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the back pasture.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: It was mostly uphill because the top of the pasture is on high ground,
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and it sloped down to the crick on the other side of the rise.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Well, I reached the top of the hill and looked down. The crick were a
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: regular river now, rushing along like Niagary. On the other side of it
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: was a stand of timber, then the slope of Shattuck mountain. And I saw
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: right away the long streak where all the timber had been cut out in a
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: big scoop with roots standing up in the air and a big slide of rocks
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: down to the water.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: It was still raining a mite and the ground was sloshy and squanchy
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: under foot. Kate scrunched her hooves and got real balky, not likin' it
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: a bit. When we got to the top of the pasture she started to whine and
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: whicker and stamp, and no matter how loud I whoa-ed she kept on
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: a-stamping and I was plumb scared she'd pitch me off in the mud. Then I
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: started to smell a funny smell, like somethin' burning. Now, don't ask
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: me how anything could burn in all that water, because I don't know.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: When we came up on the rise I saw the contraption.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Rev'rend, it was the most tarnal crazy contraption I ever saw in my
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: life. It was bigger nor my cowshed and it was long and thin and as shiny
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: as Marthy's old pewter pitcher her Ma brought from England. It had a
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: pair of red rods sticking out behind and a crazy globe fitted up where
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the top ought to be. It was stuck in the mud, turned halfway over on the
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: little slide of roots and rocks, and I could see what had happened, all
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: right.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The thing must have been--now, Rev'rend, you can say what you like but
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: that thing must have _flew_ across Shattuck and landed on the slope in
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the trees, then turned over and slid down the hill. That must have been
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the crash we heard. The rods weren't just red, they were _red-hot_. I
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: could hear them sizzle as the rain hit 'em.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: In the middle of the infernal contraption there was a door, and it hung
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: all to-other as if every hinge on it had been wrenched halfway off. As I
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: pushed old Kate alongside it I heared somebody hollering alongside the
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: contraption. I didn't nohow get the words but it must have been for
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: help, because I looked down and there was a man a-flopping along in the
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: water.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: He was a big fellow and he wasn't swimming, just thrashin' and
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: hollering. So I pulled off my coat and boots and hove in after him. The
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: stream was running fast but he was near the edge and I managed to catch
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: on to an old tree-root and hang on, keeping his head out of the water
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: till I got my feet aground. Then I hauled him onto the bank. Up above me
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Kate was still whinnying and raising Ned and I shouted at her as I bent
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: over the man.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Wal, Rev'rend, he sure did give me a surprise--weren't no proper man I'd
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: ever seed before. He was wearing some kind of red clothes, real shiny
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and sort of stretchy and not wet from the water, like you'd expect, but
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: dry and it felt like that silk and India-rubber stuff mixed together.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: And it was such a bright red that at first I didn't see the blood on it.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: When I did I knew he were a goner. His chest were all stove in, smashed
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: to pieces. One of the old tree-roots must have jabbed him as the current
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: flung him down. I thought he were dead already, but then he opened up
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: his eyes.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: A funny color they were, greeny yellow. And I swear, Rev'rend, when he
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: opened them eyes I _felt_ he was readin' my mind. I thought maybe he
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: might be one of them circus fellers in their flying contraptions that
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: hang at the bottom of a balloon.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: He spoke to me in English, kind of choky and stiff, not like Joe the
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Portygee sailor or like those tarnal dumb Frenchies up Canady way,
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: but--well, funny. He said, "My baby--in ship. Get--baby ..." He tried to
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: say more but his eyes went shut and he moaned hard.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I yelped, "Godamighty!" 'Scuse me, Rev'rend, but I was so blame upset
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: that's just what I did say, "Godamighty, man, you mean there's a baby in
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: that there dingfol contraption?" He just moaned so after spreadin' my
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: coat around the man a little bit I just plunged in that there river
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: again.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Rev'rend, I heard tell once about some tomfool idiot going over Niagary
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: in a barrel, and I tell you it was like that when I tried crossin' that
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: freshet to reach the contraption.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I went under and down, and was whacked by floating sticks and whirled
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: around in the freshet. But somehow, I d'no how except by the pure grace
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: of God, I got across that raging torrent and clumb up to where the crazy
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: dingfol machine was sitting.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Ship, he'd called it. But that were no ship, Rev'rend, it was some
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: flying dragon kind of thing. It was a real scarey lookin' thing but I
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: clumb up to the little door and hauled myself inside it. And, sure
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: enough, there was other people in the cabin, only they was all dead.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: There was a lady and a man and some kind of an animal looked like a
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: bobcat only smaller, with a funny-shaped rooster-comb thing on its head.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: They all--even the cat-thing--was wearing those shiny, stretchy clo'es.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: And they all was so battered and smashed I didn't even bother to hunt
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: for their heartbeats. I could see by a look they was dead as a doornail.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Then I heard a funny little whimper, like a kitten, and in a funny,
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: rubber-cushioned thing there's a little boy baby, looked about six
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: months old. He was howling lusty enough, and when I lifted him out of
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the cradle kind of thing, I saw why. That boy baby, he was wet, and his
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: little arm was twisted under him. That there flying contraption must
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: have smashed down awful hard, but that rubber hammock was so soft and
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: cushiony all it did to him was jolt him good.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I looked around but I couldn't find anything to wrap him in. And the
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: baby didn't have a stitch on him except a sort of spongy paper diaper,
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: wet as sin. So I finally lifted up the lady, who had a long cape thing
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: around her, and I took the cape off her real gentle. I knew she was dead
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and she wouldn't be needin' it, and that boy baby would catch his death
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: if I took him out bare-naked like that. She was probably the baby's Ma;
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: a right pretty woman she was but smashed up something shameful.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: So anyhow, to make a long story short, I got that baby boy back across
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: that Niagary falls somehow, and laid him down by his Pa. The man opened
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: his eyes kind, and said in a choky voice, "Take care--baby."
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I told him I would, and said I'd try to get him up to the house where
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Marthy could doctor him. The man told me not to bother. "I dying," he
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: says. "We come from planet--star up there--crash here--" His voice
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: trailed off into a language I couldn't understand, and he looked like he
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: was praying.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I bent over him and held his head on my knees real easy, and I said,
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Don't worry, mister, I'll take care of your little fellow until your
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: folks come after him. Before God I will."
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: So the man closed his eyes and I said, _Our Father which art in Heaven_,
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and when I got through he was dead.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I got him up on Kate, but he was cruel heavy for all he was such a tall
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: skinny fellow. Then I wrapped that there baby up in the cape thing and
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: took him home and give him to Marthy. And the next day I buried the
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: fellow in the south medder and next meetin' day we had the baby baptized
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Matthew Daniel Emmett, and brung him up just like our own kids. That's
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: all.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: _All? Mr. Emmett, didn't you ever find out where that ship really came
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: from?_
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Why, Rev'rend, he said it come from a star. Dying men don't lie, you
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: know that. I asked the Teacher about them planets he mentioned and she
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: says that on one of the planets--can't rightly remember the name, March
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: or Mark or something like that--she says some big scientist feller with
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: a telescope saw canals on that planet, and they'd hev to be pretty near
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: as big as this-here Erie canal to see them so far off. And if they could
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: build canals on that planet I d'no why they couldn't build a flying
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: machine.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I went back the next day when the water was down a little, to see if I
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: couldn't get the rest of them folks and bury them, but the flying
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: machine had broke up and washed down the crick.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Marthy's still got the cape thing. She's a powerful saving woman. We
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: never did tell Matt, though. Might make him feel funny to think he
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: didn't really b'long to us.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: _But--but--Mr. Emmett, didn't anybody ask questions about the
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: baby--where you got it?_
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Well, now, I'll 'low they was curious, because Marthy hadn't been in
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the family way and they knew it. But up here folks minds their own
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: business pretty well, and I jest let them wonder. I told Liza Grace I'd
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: found her new little brother in the back pasture, and o'course it was
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the truth. When Liza Grace growed up she thought it was jest one of
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: those yarns old folks tell the little shavers.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: _And has Matthew ever shown any differences from the other children that
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: you could see?_
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Well, Rev'rend, not so's you could notice it. He's powerful smart, but
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: his real Pa and Ma must have been right smart too to build a flying
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: contraption that could come so far.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: O'course, when he were about twelve years old he started reading folks'
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: minds, which didn't seem exactly right. He'd tell Marthy what I was
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: thinkin' and things like that. He was just at the pesky age. Liza Grace
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and Minnie were both a-courtin' then, and he'd drive their boy friends
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: crazy telling them what Liza Grace and Minnie were a-thinking and tease
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the gals by telling them what the boys were thinking about.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: There weren't no harm in the boy, though, it was all teasing. But it
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: just weren't decent, somehow. So I tuk him out behind the woodshed and
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: give his britches a good dusting just to remind him that that kind of
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: thing weren't polite nohow. And Rev'rend Doane, he ain't never done it
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: sence.
title: Year of the Big Thaw
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: _Marion Zimmer Bradley has written some of the finest science
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: fiction in print. She has been away from our pages too long. So this
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: story is in the nature of a triumphant return. It could well be her
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: best to date._
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: By the time I got myself all the way awake I thought I was alone. I was
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: lying on a leather couch in a bare white room with huge windows,
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: alternate glass-brick and clear glass. Beyond the clear windows was a
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: view of snow-peaked mountains which turned to pale shadows in the
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: glass-brick.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Habit and memory fitted names to all these; the bare office, the orange
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: flare of the great sun, the names of the dimming mountains. But beyond a
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: polished glass desk, a man sat watching me. And I had never seen the man
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: before.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: He was chubby, and not young, and had ginger-colored eyebrows and a
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: fringe of ginger-colored hair around the edges of a forehead which was
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: otherwise quite pink and bald. He was wearing a white uniform coat, and
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the intertwined caduceus on the pocket and on the sleeve proclaimed him
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: a member of the Medical Service attached to the Civilian HQ of the
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Terran Trade City.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I didn't stop to make all these evaluations consciously, of course. They
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: were just part of my world when I woke up and found it taking shape
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: around me. The familiar mountains, the familiar sun, the strange man.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: But he spoke to me in a friendly way, as if it were an ordinary thing to
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: find a perfect stranger sprawled out taking a siesta in here.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Could I trouble you to tell me your name?"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: That was reasonable enough. If I found somebody making himself at home
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: in my office--if I had an office--I'd ask him his name, too. I started
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: to swing my legs to the floor, and had to stop and steady myself with
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: one hand while the room drifted in giddy circles around me.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: [Illustration: The man in the mirror was a stranger.]
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "I wouldn't try to sit up just yet," he remarked, while the floor calmed
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: down again. Then he repeated, politely but insistently, "Your name?"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Oh, yes. My name." It was--I fumbled through layers of what felt like
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: gray fuzz, trying to lay my tongue on the most familiar of all sounds,
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: my own name. It was--why, it was--I said, on a high rising note, "This
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: is damn silly," and swallowed. And swallowed again. Hard.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Calm down," the chubby man said soothingly. That was easier said than
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: done. I stared at him in growing panic and demanded, "But, but, have I
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: had amnesia or something?"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Or something."
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "What's my _name_?"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Now, now, take it easy! I'm sure you'll remember it soon enough. You
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: can answer other questions, I'm sure. How old are you?"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I answered eagerly and quickly, "Twenty-two."
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The chubby man scribbled something on a card. "Interesting.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: In-ter-est-ing. Do you know where we are?"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I looked around the office. "In the Terran Headquarters. From your
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: uniform, I'd say we were on Floor 8--Medical."
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: He nodded and scribbled again, pursing his lips. "Can you--uh--tell me
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: what planet we are on?"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I had to laugh. "Darkover," I chuckled, "I hope! And if you want the
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: names of the moons, or the date of the founding of the Trade City, or
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: something--"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: He gave in, laughing with me. "Remember where you were born?"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "On Samarra. I came here when I was three years old--my father was in

text: All that day we rode upward, encamping at the furthest point we could
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: travel with pack animals or mounted. The next day's climb would enter
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the dangerous trails we must travel afoot. We pitched a comfortable
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: camp, but I admit I slept badly. Kendricks and Lerrys and Rafe had
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: blinding headaches from the sun and the thinness of the air; I was more
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: used to these conditions, but I felt a sense of unpleasant pressure, and
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: my ears rang. Regis arrogantly denied any discomfort, but he moaned and
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: cried out continuously in his sleep until Lerrys kicked him, after which
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: he was silent and, I feared, sleepless. Kyla seemed the least affected
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: of any; probably she had been at higher altitudes more continuously than
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: any of us. But there were dark circles beneath her eyes.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: However, no one complained as we readied ourselves for the final last
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: long climb upward. If we were fortunate, we could cross Dammerung before
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: nightfall; at the very least, we should bivouac tonight very near the
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: pass. Our camp had been made at the last level spot; we partially
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: hobbled the pack animals so they would not stray too far, and left ample
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: food for them, and cached all but the most necessary of light trail
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: gear. As we prepared to start upward on the steep, narrow track--hardly
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: more than a rabbit-run--I glanced at Kyla and stated, "We'll work on
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: rope from the first stretch. Starting now."
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: One of the Darkovan brothers stared at me with contempt. "Call yourself
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: a mountain man, Jason? Why, my little daughter could scramble up _that_
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: track without so much as a push on her behind!"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I set my chin and glared at him. "The rocks aren't easy, and some of
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: these men aren't used to working on rope at all. We might as well get
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: used to it, because when we start working along the ledges, I don't want
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: anybody who doesn't know how."
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: They still didn't like it, but nobody protested further until I directed
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the huge Kendricks to the center of the second rope. He glared viciously
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: at the light nylon line and demanded in some apprehension, "Hadn't I
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: better go last until I know what I'm doing? Hemmed in between the two of
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: you, I'm apt to do something damned dumb!"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Hjalmar roared with laughter and informed him that the center place on a
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: 3-man rope was always reserved for weaklings, novices and amateurs. I
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: expected Kendricks' temper to flare up: the burly Spaceforce man and the
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Darkovan giant glared at one another, then Kendricks only shrugged and
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: knotted the line through his belt. Kyla warned Kendricks and Lerrys
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: about looking down from ledges, and we started.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The first stretch was almost too simple, a clear track winding higher
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and higher for a couple of miles. Pausing to rest for a moment, we could
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: turn and see the entire valley outspread below us. Gradually the trail
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: grew steeper, in spots pitched almost at a 50-degree angle, and was
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: scattered with gravel, loose rock and shale, so that we placed our feet
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: carefully, leaning forward to catch at handholds and steady ourselves
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: against rocks. I tested each boulder carefully, since any weight placed
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: against an unsteady rock might dislodge it on somebody below. One of the
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Darkovan brothers--Vardo, I thought--was behind me, separated by ten or
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: twelve feet of slack rope, and twice when his feet slipped on gravel he
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: stumbled and gave me an unpleasant jerk. What he muttered was perfectly
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: true; on slopes like this, where a fall wasn't dangerous anyhow, it was
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: better to work unroped; then a slip bothered no one but the slipper.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: But I was finding out what I wanted to know--what kind of climbers I had
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: to lead through the Hellers.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Along a cliff face the trail narrowed horizontally, leading across a
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: foot-wide ledge overhanging a sheer drop of fifty feet and covered with
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: loose shale and scrub plants. Nothing, of course, to an experienced
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: climber--a foot-wide ledge might as well be a four-lane superhighway.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Kendricks made a nervous joke about a tightrope walker, but when his
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: turn came he picked his way securely, without losing balance. The
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: amateurs--Lerrys Ridenow, Regis, Rafe--came across without hesitation,
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: but I wondered how well they would have done at a less secure altitude;
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: to a real mountaineer, a footpath is a footpath, whether in a meadow,
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: above a two-foot drop, a thirty-foot ledge, or a sheer mountain face
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: three miles above the first level spot.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: After crossing the ledge the going was harder. A steeper trail, in
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: places nearly imperceptible, led between thick scrub and overhanging
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: trees, thickly forested. In spots their twisted roots obscured the
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: trail; in others the persistent growth had thrust aside rocks and dirt.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: We had to make our way through tangles of underbrush which would have
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: been nothing to a trailman, but which made our ground-accustomed bodies
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: ache with the effort of getting over or through them; and once the track
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: was totally blocked by a barricade of tangled dead brushwood, borne down
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: on floodwater after a sudden thaw or cloud-burst. We had to work
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: painfully around it over a three-hundred-foot rockslide, which we could
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: cross only one at a time, crab-fashion, leaning double to balance
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: ourselves; and no one complained now about the rope.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Toward noon I had the first intimation that we were not alone on the
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: slope.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: At first it was no more than a glimpse of motion out of the corner of my
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: eyes, the shadow of a shadow. The fourth time I saw it, I called softly
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: to Kyla: "See anything?"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "I was beginning to think it was my eyes, or the altitude. I saw,
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Jason."
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Look for a spot where we can take a break," I directed. We climbed
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: along a shallow ledge, the faint imperceptible flutters in the brushwood
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: climbing with us on either side. I muttered to the girl, "I'll be glad
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: when we get clear of this. At least we'll be able to see what's coming
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: after us!"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "If it comes to a fight," she said surprisingly, "I'd rather fight on
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: gravel than ice."
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Over a rise, there was a roaring sound; Kyla swung up and balanced on a
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: rock-wedged tree root, cupped her mouth to her hands and called,
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Rapids!"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I pulled myself up to the edge of the drop and stood looking down into
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the narrow gully. Here the narrow track we had been following was
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: crossed and obscured by the deep, roaring rapids of a mountain stream.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Less than twenty feet across, it tumbled in an icy flood, almost a
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: waterfall, pitching over the lip of a crag above us. It had sliced a
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: ravine five feet deep in the mountainside, and came roaring down with a
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: rushing noise that made my head vibrate. It looked formidable; anyone
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: stepping into it would be knocked off his feet in seconds, and swept a
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: thousand feet down the mountainside by the force of the current.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Rafe scrambled gingerly over the gullied lip of the channel it had cut,
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and bent carefully to scoop up water in his palm and drink. "Phew, it's
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: colder than Zandru's ninth hell. Must come straight down from a
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: glacier!"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: It did. I remembered the trail and remembered the spot. Kendricks joined
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: me at the water's edge, and asked, "How do we get across?"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "I'm not sure," I said, studying the racing white torrent. Overhead,
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: about twenty feet from where we clustered on the slope, the thick
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: branches of enormous trees overhung the rapids, their long roots
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: partially bared, gnarled and twisted by recurrent floods; and between
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: these trees swayed one of the queer swing-bridges of the trailmen,
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: hanging only about ten feet above the water.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Even I had never learned to navigate one of these swing-bridges without
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: assistance; human arms are no longer suited to brachiation. I might have
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: managed it once; but at present, except as a desperate final expedient,
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: it was out of the question. Rafe or Lerrys, who were lightly built and
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: acrobatic, could probably do it as a simple stunt on the level, in a
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: field; on a steep and rocky mountainside, where a fall might mean being
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: dashed a thousand feet down the torrent, I doubted it. The trailmen's
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: bridge was out ... but what other choice was there?
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I beckoned to Kendricks, he being the man I was the most inclined to
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: trust with my life at the moment, and said, "It looks uncrossable, but I
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: think two men could get across, if they were steady on their feet. The
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: others can hold us on ropes, in case we do get knocked down. If we can
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: get to the opposite bank, we can stretch a fixed rope from that snub of
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: rock--" I pointed, "and the others can cross with that. The first men
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: over will be the only ones to run any risk. Want to try?"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I liked it better that he didn't answer right away, but went to the edge
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: of the gully and peered down the rocky chasm. Doubtless, if we were
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: knocked down, all seven of the others could haul us up again; but not
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: before we'd been badly smashed on the rocks. And once again I caught
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: that elusive shadow of movement in the brushwood; if the trailmen chose
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: a moment when we were half-in, half-out of the rapids, we'd be
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: ridiculously vulnerable to attack.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "We ought to be able to get a fixed rope easier than that," Hjalmar
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: said, and took one of the spares from his rucksack. He coiled it, making
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: a running loop on one end, and standing precariously on the lip of the
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: rapids, sent it spinning toward the outcrop of rock we had chosen as a
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: fixed point. "If I can get it over...."
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The rope fell short, and Hjalmar reeled it in and cast the loop again.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: He made three more unsuccessful tries before finally, with held breath,
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: we watched the noose settle over the rocky snub. Gently, pulling the
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: line taut, we watched it stretch above the rapids. The knot tightened,
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: fastened. Hjalmar grinned and let out his breath.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "There," he said, and jerked hard on the rope, testing it with a long
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: hard pull. The rocky outcrop broke, with a sharp crack, split, and
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: toppled entirely into the rapids, the sudden jerk almost pulling Hjalmar
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: off his feet. The boulder rolled, with a great bouncing splash, faster
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and faster down the mountain, taking the rope with it.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: We just stood and stared for a minute. Hjalmar swore horribly, in the
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: unprintable filth of the mountain tongue, and his brothers joined in.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "How the devil was I to know the _rock_ would split off?"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Better for it to split now than when we were depending on it," Kyla
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: said stolidly. "I have a better idea." She was untying herself from the
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: rope as she spoke, and knotting one of the spares through her belt. She
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: handed the other end of the rope to Lerrys. "Hold on to this," she said,
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and slipped out of her blankety windbreak, standing shivering in a thin
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: sweater. She unstrapped her boots and tossed them to me. "Now boost me
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: on your shoulders, Hjalmar."
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Too late, I guessed her intention and shouted, "No, don't try--!" But
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: she had already clambered to an unsteady perch on the big Darkovan's
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: shoulders and made a flying grab for the lowest loop of the trailmen's
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: bridge. She hung there, swaying slightly and sickeningly, as the loose
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: lianas gave to her weight.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Hjalmar--Lerrys--haul her down!"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "I'm lighter than any of you," Kyla called shrilly, "and not hefty
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: enough to be any use on the ropes!" Her voice quavered somewhat as she
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: added, "--and hang on to that rope, Lerrys! If you lose it, I'll have
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: done this for nothing!"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: She gripped the loop of vine and reached, with her free hand, for the
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: next loop. Now she was swinging out over the edge of the boiling rapids.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Tight-mouthed, I gestured to the others to spread out slightly
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: below--not that anything would help her if she fell.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Hjalmar, watching as the woman gained the third loop--which joggled
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: horribly to her slight weight--shouted suddenly, "Kyla, quick! The loop
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: _beyond_--don't touch the next one! It's frayed--rotted through!"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Kyla brought her left hand up to her right on the third loop. She made a
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: long reach, missed her grab, swung again, and clung, breathing hard, to
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: the safe fifth loop. I watched, sick with dread. The damned girl should
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: have told me what she intended.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Kyla glanced down and we got a glimpse of her face, glistening with the
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: mixture of sunburn cream and sweat, drawn with effort. Her tiny swaying
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: figure hung twelve feet above the white tumbling water, and if she lost
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: her grip, only a miracle could bring her out alive. She hung there for a
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: minute, jiggling slightly, then started a long back-and-forward swing.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: On the third forward swing she made a long leap and grabbed at the final
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: loop.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: It slipped through her fingers; she made a wild grab with the other
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: hand, and the liana dipped sharply under her weight, raced through her
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: fingers, and with a sharp snap, broke in two. She gave a wild shriek as
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: it parted, and twisted her body frantically in mid-air, landing asprawl
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: half-in, half-out of the rapids, but on the further bank. She hauled her
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: legs up on dry land and crouched there, drenched to the waist but safe.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: [Illustration: The rope swung perilously, threatening to dash her on the
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: rocks.]
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: The Darkovans were yelling in delight. I motioned to Lerrys to make his
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: end of the rope fast around a hefty tree-root, and shouted, "Are you
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: hurt?" She indicated in pantomime that the thundering of the water
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: drowned words, and bent to belay her end of the rope. In sign-language I
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: gestured to her to make very sure of the knots; if anyone slipped, she
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: hadn't the weight to hold us.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: I hauled on the rope myself to test it, and it held fast. I slung her
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: boots around my neck by their cords, then, gripping the fixed rope,
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Kendricks and I stepped into the water.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: It was even icier than I expected, and my first step was nearly the
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: last; the rush of the white water knocked me to my knees, and I
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: floundered and would have measured my length except for my hands on the
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: fixed rope. Buck Kendricks grabbed at me, letting go the rope to do it,
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: and I swore at him, raging, while we got on our feet again and braced
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: ourselves against the onrushing current. While we struggled in the
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: pounding waters, I admitted to myself; we could never have crossed
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: without the rope Kyla had risked her life to fix.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Shivering, we got across and hauled ourselves out. I signalled to the
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: others to cross two at a time, and Kyla seized my elbow. "Jason--"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "Later, dammit!" I had to shout to make myself heard over the roaring
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: water, as I held out a hand to help Rafe get his footing on the ledge.
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "This--can't--wait," she yelled, cupping her hands and shouting into my
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: ear. I turned on her. "_What!_"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: "There are--_trailmen_--on the top level--of that bridge! I saw them!
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: They cut the loop!"
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Regis and Hjalmar came struggling across last; Regis, lightly-built, was
title: The Planet Savers
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: swept off his feet and Hjalmar turned to grab him, but I shouted to him

text: He began to pace the floor restlessly. "They were men--once," he said.
title: Falcons of Narabedla

title: Falcons of Narabedla

title: Falcons of Narabedla
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: came out of the Cataclysm; some say they are the souls of the dead
title: Falcons of Narabedla
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Machines. They are human--and not human. They were telepaths. They
title: Falcons of Narabedla
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: could control everything--things, minds, people. They could throw
title: Falcons of Narabedla

title: Falcons of Narabedla
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: He sat down; his voice became brooding, quiet. "One of us, here
title: Falcons of Narabedla
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: in Rainbow City, a dozen generations ago, found a way to bind the
title: Falcons of Narabedla
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Dreamers," he said. "We could not kill them; they were deathless,
title: Falcons of Narabedla
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: normally. But we could bind them in sleep. As they slept, under a
title: Falcons of Narabedla
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: Falcons of Narabedla

text: we controlled the things _they_ controlled. For a price." There
title: Falcons of Narabedla

title: Falcons of Narabedla

text: high."

title: Falcons of Narabedla

title: Falcons of Narabedla

title: Falcons of Narabedla
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: pleased in the chambers of my memory. But I found nothing; whoever had
title: Falcons of Narabedla
author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

title: Falcons of Narabedla

author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: vaguely in sleep. Half the known portions of this world had known the

author: Bradley, Marion Zimmer

text: Crimson Tower as lord. And Karamy--

text: vagueness came and choked me. I might think; I might burst my brain,

title: Falcons of Narabedla
